programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.longDescription: World-renowned murder mystery series set in the idyllic Midsomer county. Inspector Barnaby and his young sergeant probe an alarming number of suspicious deaths in the community.
programme.description: Visit Britain's most murderous county... new episode added!

titles.description: A writers' circle witnesses a sequence of gruesome events far stranger than any fiction.
titles.guidance: Contains some scenes of violence and sexual material.
titles.longDescription: In the tranquil village of Midsomer Worthy, the local writers' circle is eagerly anticipating a visit from a best-selling novelist. But the aspiring authors are about to witness a sequence of gruesome events far stranger than any fiction.

titles.contentInfo: S1, E2. Death of a Hollow Man
titles.description: In a quiet rural village, an elderly resident is found drowned after a violent attack.
titles.guidance: Contains some violent moments and moderate language.
titles.longDescription: In the quiet rural village of Ferne Bassett, an elderly resident is found drowned after a violent attack. Meanwhile, a local amateur dramatic production of Amadeus reveals a hitherto unseen world of intrigue and passion.

titles.description: The wife of the local craft centre's owner goes missing. Starring Mark Bazeley.
titles.guidance: Contains language that may offend some viewers.
titles.longDescription: The village of Morton Fendle seems to be overflowing with community spirit when many of the residents invest in the local craft centre. But DCI Barnaby is called in after the wife of the centre's owner goes missing and a neighbour is murdered.

titles.description: The founder of a commune is murdered, leaving an eccentric cast of suspects.
titles.guidance: Contains some violence and crime scene images.
titles.longDescription: When the founder of a nearby commune is murdered, DCI Barnaby is faced with an eccentric cast of suspects including an heiress, a psychic, and a boy who has lost his tongue.

titles.description: Richard Briers guest stars - a property developer is brutally murdered.
titles.guidance: Contains some violence and moderate language.
titles.longDescription: Richard Briers guest stars. The inhabitants of a sleepy village are shocked when a local property developer, recently diagnosed with a malignant brain tumour, is brutally murdered.

titles.description: Barnaby and Troy are led into the murky, clandestine world of Midsomer Worthy.
titles.guidance: Contains some violence and moderate language
titles.longDescription: When a woman is killed in local woodland, nine years after three identical murders, Barnaby and Troy are led into the murky, clandestine world of Midsomer Worthy.

titles.description: The wife of a wealthy landowner is bludgeoned to death with a cricket bat.
titles.guidance: Contains scenes of violence and some moderate language.
titles.longDescription: When the wife of a wealthy landowner is bludgeoned to death with a cricket bat, DCI Barnaby becomes enmeshed in a succession of calculating murders.

titles.description: Barnaby and Troy are called in to investigate the death of a local magistrate.
titles.guidance: Includes traditional dancing that might offend some viewers.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby and Troy are called in to investigate when the local magistrate, principal adversary of two groups of travellers, is found dead at his home in Martyr Warren.

titles.contentInfo: S3, E1. Death of a Stranger
titles.description: Barnaby investigates when the father of a man jailed for murder is also killed.
titles.guidance: Contains violence and some moderate language.
titles.longDescription: DCI Barnaby realises that there is more to a case than first appears, when the father of a man jailed for murder is also killed.

titles.description: Barnaby and Troy investigate the murder of an ex-schoolmistress in a nursing home.
titles.longDescription: DCI Barnaby and DS Troy are called in to investigate the murder of an ex-schoolmistress in a nursing home.

titles.description: Orlando Bloom guest stars - a thief is stabbed to death with a pitchfork.
titles.guidance: Contains violence and moderate language.
titles.longDescription: Orlando Bloom guest stars. When a thief is stabbed to death with a pitchfork and two villagers are murdered, DCI Tom Barnaby has to find the killer before he strikes again.

titles.description: Barnaby and Troy try to find out whether events in Aspern Tallow are supernatural.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby and Troy try to find out whether mysterious events in Aspern Tallow and the discovery of a body are supernatural, or if there is a rational explanation.

titles.description: Something is dug up during building work, leaving DCI Barnaby to investigate a murder.
titles.guidance: Contains violence and some strong language.
titles.longDescription: Feature-length drama. When a woman's body is discovered, Barnaby soon finds himself in the midst of witchcraft, ancient potions, infidelity and land feuds.

titles.description: Barnaby investigates when the death of a hotel owner leads to murder and intrigue.
titles.longDescription: The death of a hotel owner leads to murder and intrigue, and Detective Barnaby uncovers a web of illicit affairs and shady business dealings.

titles.description: A man is found in the middle of a crop circle, naked, with two puncture wounds.
titles.guidance: Contains some violence and autopsy nudity.
titles.longDescription: A man is found in the middle of a crop circle, naked, with two puncture wounds. A ufologist claims extra-terrestrial involvement but DCI Tom Barnaby seeks a more plausible reason.

titles.contentInfo: S4, E4. Who Killed Cock Robin?
titles.description: The disappearance of a local brings Barnaby face to face with an old adversary.
titles.longDescription: The disappearance of a villager brings DCI Tom Barnaby face to face with old adversary Melvyn Stockard, now reinvented as the local squire. When a body is pulled out of a well, Barnaby is convinced that Stockard is somehow involved.

titles.description: When a village postman is murdered, Barnaby uncovers a hotbed of adultery.
titles.guidance: Contains violence and some sexual content.
titles.longDescription: When a village postman is brutally murdered, DCI Barnaby uncovers a hotbed of adultery within the remote hamlet of Goodman's Land.

titles.description: The body of a local beauty is discovered by the pool at her house.
titles.longDescription: When the body of arrogant local beauty Melissa Townsend is discovered by the pool at her manor house, DCI Barnaby uncovers a seedy world of adultery and deceit within the affluent rural community.

titles.description: The leader of a reading club is found battered to death.
titles.longDescription: When the leader of a reading club used as a cover to run an investment portfolio is found battered to death, the club's activities are exposed and long-held secrets and desires return to haunt its members.

titles.contentInfo: S5, E2. Worm in the Bud
titles.description: When a woman's body is discovered, Barnaby soon finds himself dealing with witchcraft.
titles.longDescription: When a woman's body is discovered, Barnaby soon finds himself in the middle of a world of witchcraft, ancient potions, infidelity and land feuds.

titles.contentInfo: S5, E3. Ring Out Your Dead
titles.description: Hugh Bonnville guest stars - DCI Barnaby investigates the murders of bell-ringers.
titles.longDescription: Hugh Bonnville guest stars. DCI Barnaby investigates the murders of the village church bell-ringers, and must solve a riddle from the past before the killer strikes again.

titles.contentInfo: S5, E4. Murder on Saint Malley's Day
titles.description: The activities of an elite club at a local public school lead to murder and mayhem.
titles.longDescription: Devington College dominates the economy and social life of Midsomer Parva - but then the activities of its elite Pudding Club lead to murder.

titles.contentInfo: S6, E1. A Talent for Life
titles.description: Honor Blackman guest stars - Barnaby and Troy have to solve a double murder.
titles.longDescription: Honor Blackman guest stars. Barnaby and Troy have to solve a double murder when a feisty former socialite and a Casanova are found bludgeoned to death.

titles.description: The apparent suicide of a local ne'er-do-well arouses suspicions.
titles.guidance: Contains some adult scenes.
titles.longDescription: The apparent suicide of a local ne'er-do-well arouses suspicions due to the complexity of his death.

titles.description: John Sessions guest stars - a group of amateur painters become unwitting witnesses.
titles.longDescription: John Sessions guest stars. Some amateur painters become witnesses when one of their number is killed. As his wife is part of the group, DCI Barnaby is taken off the case.

titles.contentInfo: S6, E4. A Tale of Two Hamlets
titles.description: The death of a film star brings Barnaby and Troy to two feuding villages...
titles.longDescription: The death of a young film star at the opening of 'Satanic Experience', held at his family's ancestral home, brings Barnaby and Troy to two feuding villages.

titles.description: When Julian Shepherd is found drowned it seems as though he died of suicide.
titles.guidance: This programme contains scenes that some viewers may find distressing.
titles.longDescription: When Julian Shepherd is found drowned it seems as though he died of suicide, but Barnaby suspects foul play.

titles.description: Henry Cavill guest stars - an accident during canal restoration leads to a difficult case.
titles.guidance: Contains some adult material and the use of moderate language.
titles.longDescription: Henry Cavill guest stars. An accident during the restoration of a canal leads to a particularly difficult case for Barnaby and Troy.

titles.description: Ruth Jones guest stars - Sgt Dan Scott is thrown straight into a murder investigation.
titles.guidance: Contains some mild crime scene images.
titles.longDescription: Ruth Jones guest stars. Sergeant Dan Scott arrives to work with Barnaby and is thrown straight into a murder investigation in Midsomer Mallow.

titles.description: Long-suppressed family secrets result in a series of murders in Midsomer.
titles.guidance: Contains several references to witchcraft.
titles.longDescription: Long-suppressed family secrets, stolen ancient artefacts, and a thirty-year-old death at a Celtic burial site result in a series of murders in Midsomer.

titles.description: When Midsomer hosts its Annual Literary Festival, an author is found with a broken neck.
titles.longDescription: When Midsomer hosts its Annual Literary Festival, an author is found with a broken neck. More writers will die before the winner is announced.

titles.contentInfo: S7, E5. The Maid in Splendour
titles.description: The regulars of Midsomer Worthy's local pub are thrown into a murder case.
titles.guidance: Contains some crime scene violence and occasional use of moderate language.
titles.longDescription: The regulars of Midsomer Worthy's local pub are thrown into a murder case involving unrequited love and secret business deals, after the young barman is found dead.

titles.description: Barnaby investigates when a priest is burned to death inside the effigy of a straw woman.
titles.guidance: Contains frequent references to witchcraft and some moderately disturbing crime scenes.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby investigates when a priest is burned to death inside the effigy of a straw woman and more people burst into flames spontaneously as though by witchcraft.

titles.contentInfo: S7, E7. Ghosts of Christmas Past
titles.description: A riddle in a Christmas cracker predicts that two people will die within two days.
titles.longDescription: It is Christmas, but when the troubled Villiers family get together nine years after the death of eldest son and magician Ferdy, two deaths are predicted...

titles.contentInfo: S8, E1. Things That Go Bump in the Night
titles.description: An undertaker is found dead and suspicion turns towards a spiritualist church.
titles.episodeTitle: Things That Go Bump in the Night
titles.guidance: Contains mild references to the occult throughout.
titles.longDescription: Undertaker Patrick Pennyman is found dead with his wrists slashed, and suspicion turns towards a spiritualist church.

titles.contentInfo: S8, E2. Dead in the Water
titles.description: The body of a Rowing Club chairman is found bludgeoned and drowned during a regatta.
titles.guidance: Contains moderate language and some violence.
titles.longDescription: The body of Rowing Club chairman Guy Sweetman is found bludgeoned and drowned during a regatta. As Sweetman was prolifically promiscuous, jealousy would seem to be the motive.

titles.description: Barnaby and Troy root out a murderer motivated by a rare plant.
titles.longDescription: When one of the world's rarest orchids is smuggled illegally into Midsomer Malham, it triggers a catalogue of passion, jealousy and death.

titles.description: Barnaby investigates the case of a four-member racehorse syndicate.
titles.guidance: Contains some moderate violence.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby investigates the case of a four-member racehorse syndicate. Two of them are desperate to sell the horse and two are determined to keep it, then one member is murdered.

titles.description: Barnaby and Scott investigate the death of a man with burn marks on his skull.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby and Scott assess the post-mortem of a man involved in a pub fight. They suspect that the burn marks on his skull may indicate a different cause of death.

titles.description: Barnaby and Scott investigate whether the death of a solicitor was suicide or murder.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby and Scott investigate when a solicitor falls from a roof to his death. A revenge motive emerges when the dead man's rival also dies - but who is behind it?

titles.contentInfo: S8, E7. Sauce for the Goose
titles.description: Barnaby investigates when a naked body is found in the warehouse of a relish factory.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby investigates when a naked body is found in the warehouse of a small but respected relish factory owned by a dysfunctional family.

titles.description: Deaths follow the discovery of a valuable musical manuscript sold cheaply at an auction.
titles.longDescription: In Midsomer a local man is murdered and a valuable manuscript is found amongst his effects and Barnaby suspects it is a forgery, by someone hoping to gain a share in the continuing royalties.

titles.contentInfo: S9, E1. The House in the Woods
titles.description: Barnaby investigates the garrotting of a husband and wife outside a deserted cottage.
titles.guidance: May contain scenes of violence, crime scenes and moderate language.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby and Acting DC Ben Jones investigate the garrotting of a husband and wife outside a deserted cottage.

titles.description: Midsomer is celebrating Oak Apple Week when a mother is found drowned. Is it suicide?
titles.guidance: Contains some mild scenes of violence.
titles.longDescription: Midsomer Barton is celebrating Oak Apple Week when a mother is found drowned. It looks like suicide and that she was driven to it by grief.

titles.description: Sir Freddy Butler's death looks like a heart attack until his will disappears.
titles.guidance: Contains mild language & some violence.
titles.longDescription: Sir Freddy Butler's death brings Barnaby and Jones to the privileged surroundings of Haddington Hall. The cause of death looks like a heart attack until Freddy's will disappears.

titles.contentInfo: S9, E4. Down Among the Dead Men
titles.description: When a council clerk is shot dead, Barnaby and Jones discover that he was a blackmailer.
titles.longDescription: When a council clerk is shot dead, Barnaby and Jones discover that he was a blackmailer. They investigate which of his victims hated him enough to kill him.

titles.description: A baritone is killed just days before a choir competition.
titles.guidance: Contains some violence.
titles.longDescription: After Midsomer Worthy's baritone Connor Simpson is killed just days before a choir competition, the race is on for Barnaby and Jones to catch the killer.

titles.description: Controversial plans to build a supermarket in Elverton-cum-Latterly lead to murder.
titles.guidance: Contains some moderate violence and scenes of a sexual nature.
titles.longDescription: Controversial plans to build a supermarket in Elverton-cum-Latterly lead to murder when a man is stabbed. Can Barnaby and Jones uncover the killer?

titles.description: Barnaby questions the guilt of a woman who is on trial for the murder of her best friend.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby begins to question the guilt of a woman who is on trial for the murder of her best friend when the prosecution's claims do not appear to add up.

titles.contentInfo: S9, E8. Four Funerals and a Wedding
titles.description: An ageing feminist and a misogynist vicar are murdered. Extended episode.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby uncovers a decades-old battle of the sexes when ageing feminist Mildred Danvers and misogynist vicar Rev Gantis are murdered. Extended episode.

titles.contentInfo: S10, E1. Dance with the Dead
titles.description: A young man is found dead in a car filled with exhaust fumes and it looks like suicide.
titles.longDescription: When the body of a young man is found in a Second World War-era motor car filled with exhaust fumes, it looks like suicide. But all is not as it seems.

titles.description: A woman arrives in Midsomer to meet her long-lost uncle, only he has disappeared.
titles.guidance: Contains some crime scene images.
titles.longDescription: A woman in search of her uncle finds that he has spread rumours about her and disappeared, but worse is to follow when his corpse is discovered.

titles.description: A production of Hamlet seems to contain a message for DCI Barnaby.
titles.longDescription: A glassware factory faces ruin, an accountant is murdered with a Masonic dagger, and a production of Hamlet seems to contain a message for DCI Barnaby.

titles.description: Badger's Drift plays host to the Midsomer Rock Festival - with murderous consequences.
titles.longDescription: Badger's Drift plays host to the Midsomer Rock Festival, and the long-awaited return of the Hired Gun rock band, but there are murderous consequences.

titles.description: Barnaby investigates the death of a doctor in a hit-and-run case.
titles.longDescription: When Dr Alan Delaney is killed by a hit-and-run driver, Barnaby realises that the real target was the doctor’s senior partner, Dr James Kirkwood.

titles.description: When a local photographer is murdered, DCI Barnaby becomes the prime suspect in the case.
titles.longDescription: When a local photographer is murdered, DCI Barnaby becomes the prime suspect in the case. As the evidence mounts against him, will he be able to clear his name?

titles.contentInfo: S10, E7. They Seek Him Here
titles.description: Deaths occur during the making of a film about the French Revolution, but why?
titles.guidance: Contains scenes some viewers may find distressing.
titles.longDescription: A film about the French Revolution is made in Midsomer Magna. People are beheaded by a guillotine on set, and it's not a film trick.

titles.contentInfo: S10, E8. Death in a Chocolate Box
titles.description: When a former colleague is killed, Barnaby investigates a halfway house for ex-prisoners.
titles.guidance: With some violence.
titles.longDescription: When Barnaby's former colleague is killed, he investigates a link between a halfway house for ex-prisoners and a seedy group called the Friday Nighters.

titles.description: A long-running feud between two families appears to have escalated to murder.
titles.guidance: Contains strong language.
titles.longDescription: After a war memorial is unveiled in Midsomer Parva, a 90-year feud between the Hicks and the Hammonds families results in a murder.

titles.description: Barnaby is an unwelcome guest at a wedding when the maid of honour is stabbed to death.
titles.guidance: Contains scenes of violence.
titles.longDescription: As his daughter Cully prepares for her upcoming wedding, Barnaby is called to another celebration, that of aristocrat Ned Fitzroy, at which the maid of honour is murdered.

titles.description: Jones revisits childhood memories as he investigates two murders in his hometown.
titles.longDescription: Jones back to his hometown to investigate the murders of a reclusive couple and someone at the wedding of an old friend, causing childhood memories to come flooding back.

titles.description: When a body is found in woodland, the outspoken owner of a magazine comes under suspicion.
titles.guidance: Contains adult themes.
titles.longDescription: When a body is found in woodland near Midsomer Sonning, country magazine Midsomer Life and its outspoken owner Guy Sandys come under scrutiny from Barnaby and Jones.

titles.description: Barnaby and Jones investigate the secretive world of Midsomer's Magic Circle.
titles.longDescription: A magician's assistant drops dead during a show, having been poisoned by a deadly frog. Barnaby and Jones investigate the secretive world of Midsomer's Magic Circle.

titles.description: Barnaby investigates an explosion at a haulage yard.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby investigates an explosion at a haulage yard. When a body turns up, there are plenty of suspects, including a grieving mother and a group of Territorial Army soldiers.

titles.contentInfo: S11, E7. Talking to the Dead
titles.description: Barnaby and Jones uncover strange rituals among the locals of Monks Barton.
titles.guidance: Contains scenes of violence.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby investigates a supposedly haunted forest, the disappearances of two couples, and a gang of antiquity thieves.

titles.description: A golf club is rocked by controversy when a golfer is bludgeoned to death.
titles.guidance: Some mild language and violence.
titles.longDescription: A golf club is rocked by controversy when a golfer is bludgeoned to death. Barnaby and Jones uncover a tale of gambling, illegal money lending and assault.

titles.description: Peter Davison guest stars - Barnaby's secret past as a spy is revealed.
titles.guidance: Contains scenes of violence and scenes that some viewers may find upsetting..
titles.longDescription: Peter Davison guest stars. DCI Barnaby's secret past as a spy is revealed when a former agent is found dead following a cricket match in Midsomer Parva.

titles.description: The previous owner of a painting is killed just before it sells for big money at auction.
titles.guidance: With some nudity.
titles.longDescription: A recently discovered piece by a local artist fetches an impressive price at auction just hours before its previous owner is murdered.

titles.description: A scientist threatens to reveal details of a glitch in an air traffic control system.
titles.longDescription: When a local scientist threatens to reveal details of a potentially lethal software glitch in a new air traffic control system, Barnaby considers the intended target of a murder.

titles.description: Olivia Colman guest stars - the body of a local troublemaker is found near Midsomer.
titles.longDescription: Olivia Colman guest stars. Barnaby delves into the truth behind the residents of Little Worthy, after the body of a troublemaker and lothario is found dead in the model village.

titles.description: Rik Mayall guest stars - Barnaby and Jones investigate murder at a dinner party.
titles.longDescription: Rik Mayall guest stars. A burglar known as 'The Creeper' terrorises Midsomer as Barnaby and Jones investigate the murder of a dinner party guest at upper-crust Chettham Park House.

titles.contentInfo: S12, E7. The Great and the Good
titles.description: When a councillor is found dead, Barnaby and Jones uncover jealous rivals.
titles.longDescription: When a councillor is found dead in a schoolteacher's garden, Barnaby and Jones uncover jealous rivals, ruthless social climbers and a cottage with secrets.

titles.contentInfo: S13, E1. The Sword of Guillaume
titles.description: Barnaby travels to Brighton to look into the beheading of a hated property developer.
titles.guidance: With scenes some viewers may find disturbing.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby heads to Brighton where a property developer is beheaded at a fair. But what's the connection to a lady desperate to preserve her family line?

titles.description: Barnaby and Jones investigate the stabbing of a woman in a feudal village.
titles.longDescription: When Sonia Woodley is stabbed in the churchyard, Barnaby and Jones investigate - and the feudal village of Milton Cross starts to reveal its secrets.

titles.contentInfo: S13, E3. Blood on the Saddle
titles.description: The annual Wild West fair becomes terrifyingly real when locals clash over land ownership.
titles.longDescription: In the village of Ford Florey, the annual Wild West fair becomes terrifyingly real when locals clash over the ownership of a piece of wasteland.

titles.description: Can DCI Tom Barnaby convince his wife she is not to blame for a man's death?
titles.longDescription: Barnaby's wife Joyce swerves her car around a shadowy figure in the road. Later that night a body is discovered in the old cemetery. Was Joyce responsbile?

titles.description: Barnaby is struck by the similarity of a drowning to a mysterious case from 20 years ago.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby and Jones investigate the drowning of a woman who jumped from a bridge, and discover connections to the past. Can they intervene before the body count escalates?

titles.description: Betrayal and blackmail fester as plans to re-enact a prizefight from 1860 turn nasty.
titles.longDescription: Betrayal and blackmail fester in Midsomer Morchard as plans to re-enact a famous boxing match from 1860 turn nasty - and even Barnaby finds his judgement clouded.

titles.contentInfo: S13, E7. Not in My Back Yard
titles.description: A planning dispute turns to murder after a woman suspects her neighbours of fraud.
titles.longDescription: A planning dispute turns to murder after a member of a conservation society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam.

titles.description: Lesley Manville guest stars - Barnaby uncovers a feud between neighbours.
titles.longDescription: Lesley Manville guest stars. When a woman dies at a health spa, Barnaby uncovers a feud between neighbours and the mystery of a half-written novel. John Nettles' final case.

titles.contentInfo: S14, E1. Death in the Slow Lane
titles.description: New DCI Barnaby looks into the murder of a local DJ, crushed to death at a girls' school.
titles.guidance: Contains scenes of violence and some moderate language.
titles.longDescription: The first case for new DCI John Barnaby is the death of a local DJ, who is crushed by a crank hammer at a girls' boarding school.

titles.description: Edward Fox guest stars - John Barnaby's second case involves the death of an official.
titles.longDescription: Edward Fox guest stars. The lives of an eccentric couple are scrutinised when a council official is killed, and new DCI Barnaby must unearth old family secrets to find the killer.

titles.contentInfo: S14, E3. Echoes of the Dead
titles.description: Pam Ferris guest stars - a woman dressed as a bride is found murdered.
titles.guidance: Contains some scenes of graphic violence and frequent swearing.
titles.longDescription: Pam Ferris guest stars. When a young woman is found dressed as a bride and drowned in a bath, it triggers a spate of ghoulish, wedding-themed murders. Is history repeating itself?

titles.description: Barnaby sends Jones undercover to investigate the disappearance of a female cult member.
titles.guidance: Scenes of violence throughout.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby sends Jones undercover to investigate the disappearance of a female member of a New Age cult - is the case linked to a deadly boat explosion?

titles.contentInfo: S14, E5. The Sleeper Under the Hill
titles.description: Fingers point at local druids when a farmer is found murdered at a sacred stone circle.
titles.guidance: Contains violence from the outset and throughout and some moderate language.
titles.longDescription: Fingers point at local druids when a farmer is found murdered at a sacred stone circle, but Barnaby wonders if basic human greed is the real motive.

titles.contentInfo: S14, E6. The Night of the Stag
titles.description: Barnaby and Jones hunt for a killer in a Midsomer village steeped in bizarre traditions.
titles.guidance: With scenes of sexual violence against women, in an imitation of ancient pagan customs
titles.longDescription: When a missing man turns up dead in a vat of cider, Barnaby and Jones must hunt for a killer in a Midsomer village that is steeped in bizarre local traditions.

titles.description: When a nun is killed at Midsomer Priory, a complex case ensues for Barnaby and Jones.
titles.longDescription: When a nun is killed at Midsomer Priory, teenage liaisons, missing antique silver, African art and holy orders make it a complex investigation for Barnaby and Jones.

titles.description: A keen birdwatcher is killed. Was his obsession with ornithology to blame?
titles.longDescription: When a keen birdwatcher is killed, Barnaby and Jones go to investigate. Was the man's obsession with ornithology to blame, or something more sinister?

titles.description: The appearance of a headless horseman at Quitewell Hall foreshadows a number of deaths.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby and Jones investigate when the appearance of a headless horseman at Quitewell Hall foreshadows a number of deaths among an aristocratic family.

titles.description: When a barrister is killed, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton.
titles.longDescription: When a barrister is killed, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. He has a solid alibi, but Barnaby suspects that he is working with an accomplice.

titles.contentInfo: S15, E3. Written In The Stars
titles.description: Maureen Lipman guest stars - during a total eclipse, an amateur astronomer is murdered.
titles.guidance: Contains some violent scenes.
titles.longDescription: Maureen Lipman guest stars. During a total eclipse, an amateur astronomer is killed by a blow to the head. Barnaby and Jones soon discover a dark side to the star-seeking world.

titles.contentInfo: S15, E4. Death and the Divas
titles.description: The murder of a journalist has echoes of a 1960s horror film starring a local actress.
titles.guidance: Contains some violence.
titles.longDescription: When the famous sister of a local actress returns after 40 years, a series of killings escalate, each of them reminiscent of a movie plot.

titles.description: Could the attack which left a woman for dead be linked to moves on a chess board?
titles.guidance: Contains some violence.
titles.longDescription: Could the attack which left Harriet Farmer for dead a year ago be linked to moves on a chess board? And where is her boyfriend Finn?

titles.description: Martine McCutcheon guest stars - a woman is crushed by a giant round of cheese.
titles.guidance: Contains scenes of violence.
titles.longDescription: Martine McCutcheon guest stars. When a woman is crushed to death by a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue, Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case.

titles.description: New DS Charlie Nelson is thrown straight into a murder case when a man is stabbed.
titles.longDescription: New DS Charlie Nelson is thrown straight into a murder case when a man is stabbed with an antique sword at a ghost-hunting party.

titles.description: Barnaby investigates murders inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco.
titles.longDescription: In Midsomer St Claire, some murders seem to be inspired by the macabre images on a medieval fresco, discovered in the church crypt. Barnaby and Nelson look deeper into the truth.

titles.description: A farmer is covered in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar.
titles.longDescription: When farmer Martin Strickland is covered in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads to Wyvern House restaurant and its tyrannical chef.

titles.description: June Whitfield guest stars - Barnaby and Nelson find a world of stunt pilots and secrets.
titles.longDescription: June Whitfield guest stars. When a body drops out of a plane and is discovered in a reservoir, Barnaby and Nelson find that the world of stunt pilots hides many dark secrets.

titles.contentInfo: S16, E5. The Killings of Copenhagen
titles.description: Barnaby and Nelson head to Copenhagen when a Midsomer resident is found dead there.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby and Nelson travel to Copenhagen to join forces with local police, after the body of a Midsomer resident is found in the Danish city. 100th episode of the detective series.

titles.description: At a crime festival, a manuscript is stolen and a woman is fatally electrocuted.
titles.longDescription: A crime festival in Luxton Deeping is jeopardised when a manuscript is stolen and a woman is fatally electrocuted.

titles.description: Barnaby uncovers conflict between the village church and some ancient pagan traditions.
titles.longDescription: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and some ancient pagan traditions.

titles.contentInfo: S17, E3. The Ballad of Midsomer
titles.description: Barnaby investigates whether a folk ballad could have been the inspiration for a murder.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby investigates whether a ballad made famous by a late, lamented folk singer could have been the inspiration for a murder.

titles.description: Barnaby tries to find out who is targeting the Midsomer Vinae Winery.
titles.longDescription: Barnaby tries to find out who is targeting the Midsomer Vinae Winery. And what does the attack have to do with the death of a child in a hit-and-run accident?

titles.description: When a body goes missing, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson seek to identify the culprit.
titles.guidance: Contains some violence.
titles.longDescription: When a wealthy landowner's body goes missing on the night of his death, DCI Barnaby, DS Nelson and new forensic pathologist Kam Karimore seek to identify the culprit.

titles.contentInfo: S18, E2. The Incident at Cooper Hill
titles.description: When a forest ranger dies, UFO spotters are convinced aliens are responsible.
titles.guidance: Includes some scenes of violence.
titles.longDescription: When a forest ranger dies, UFO spotters are convinced aliens are responsible. The betrayals and secrets that emerge during Barnaby's investigation give him some useful pointers.

titles.description: Barnaby and Nelson are drawn into a ruthless world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed.
titles.longDescription: When the leader in a cycle race is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson are drawn into a ruthlessly competitive world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed.

titles.description: When art comes to the picturesque Midsomer village of Angel's Rise, a murder soon follows.
titles.guidance: With violent scenes.
titles.longDescription: Art comes to the picturesque Midsomer village of Angel's Rise with the opening of a new sculpture park, but DCI Barnaby must get creative when murder mars its opening.

titles.description: Julia Sawalha guest stars - finding bones at an archaeological dig causes a stir.
titles.guidance: Contains some violence.
titles.longDescription: Julia Sawalha guest stars. The discovery of a saint's bones at an archaeological dig causes a stir in the village of Midsomer Cicely when the leader of the dig is murdered.

titles.description: The owner of an equestrian centre is trampled to death by his horse.
titles.guidance: With scenes of violence.
titles.longDescription: When the owner of an equestrian centre is trampled by his horse, Barnaby and Nelson have to unravel a complex feud from the past where nothing is what it seems.

titles.contentInfo: S19, E1. The Village That Rose From the Dead
titles.description: Sally Phillips guest stars - a murder in a ghost village leads towards a web of lies.
titles.episodeTitle: The Village That Rose From the Dead
titles.guidance: With some crime scene violence.
titles.longDescription: Sally Phillips guest stars. Someone is murdered during the reopening of a ghost village. DCI Barnaby must unravel a web of lies from past and present in order to catch the killer.

titles.description: Neil Morrissey guest stars - Barnaby investigates the death of a member of a patrol group.
titles.longDescription: Neil Morrissey guest stars. Barnaby learns how far some people will go for power when he investigates the death of someone from a patrol group in Midsomer's most remote village.

titles.description: Remembering John Bird - star of this Midsomer mystery
titles.longDescription: Barnaby and Winter investigate the death of a star cricketer during a tournament, but could the dislike of a cricket format really be the motive for murder?

titles.contentInfo: S19, E4. Red In Tooth and Claw
titles.description: Steve Pemberton guest stars - Barnaby and Winter find a dead body covered in live rabbits.
titles.longDescription: Steve Pemberton guest stars. When DCI Barnaby and DS Winter discover a dead body covered in live rabbits, a sinister side to the pet show is revealed. Is this rivalry gone too far?

titles.description: Barnaby and Winter hunt a killer when a young girl slips away from a Jane Austen weekend.
titles.longDescription: DCI Barnaby and DS Winter hunt a killer after a young girl dressed in period costume slips away from a Jane Austen weekend and is found dead in the woods.

titles.contentInfo: S19, E6. The Curse of the Ninth
titles.description: When a musician is murdered, the investigation leads to a world haunted by a curse.
titles.longDescription: When the winner of a classical music award is murdered, Barnaby and Winter's investigation leads them into a world haunted by a curse.

titles.contentInfo: S20, E1. The Ghost Of Causton Abbey
titles.description: The opening of a brewery is disrupted when a man is found boiled to death.
titles.guidance: Contains some violence.
titles.longDescription: A new brewery in Causton opens on the site of a famously cursed abbey. However, excitement turns to fear when a man is found boiled to death in a vat.

titles.contentInfo: S20, E2. Death of the Small Coppers
titles.description: A butterfly collector is found murdered - can DCI Barnaby and DS Winter catch the culprit?
titles.longDescription: A headmaster and avid butterfly collector is found murdered, pinned to the wall like one of his treasured specimens. Can DCI Barnaby and DS Winter catch the culprit in time?

titles.description: The village of Carver Valley is shocked by the murder of a former supermodel.
titles.guidance: Some violent scenes.
titles.longDescription: The village of Carver Valley is shocked by the murder of a former supermodel during its comic festival. Barnaby and Winter are left trying to separate fact from fiction.

titles.contentInfo: S20, E4. The Lions of Causton
titles.description: Investigating a death at a Rugby Club allows Barnaby to relive his former sporting glory.
titles.guidance: With some scenes of violence.
titles.longDescription: A death at Stubbington Hall Sports Club, home to the Causton Lions rugby team, allows Barnaby to relive his former sporting glory. But who held grudges towards the victim?

titles.contentInfo: S20, E5. Till Death Do Us Part
titles.description: Barnaby must unveil the killer at a wedding when the bride is murdered.
titles.longDescription: Not happy about being dragged to a wedding by his wife Sarah, things go from bad to worse for Barnaby when the bride is murdered. He must unveil the killer.

titles.contentInfo: S20, E6. Send in the Clowns
titles.description: Jason Watkins guest stars - when Ferabbees Circus arrives, Barnaby must face his fears.
titles.longDescription: Jason Watkins guest stars. A series of sinister clown sightings, threats, and deathly acts ensue when Ferabbees Circus comes to town. Barnaby must face his fears to solve the case.

titles.contentInfo: S21, E1. The Point of Balance
titles.description: Nigel Havers guest stars - Midsomer is abuzz with excitement about a new event.
titles.longDescription: Nigel Havers guest stars. Midsomer is abuzz with excitement at the arrival of the annual Paramount Dance Extravaganza. But behind the sequins are deep-running feuds and passions.

titles.description: A man is murdered at the unveiling of a new doll's house collection.
titles.longDescription: Numerous motives point towards the murder of prolific estate agent Alexander Beauvoisin, shot dead at a museum whilst unveiling a collection of doll's houses. But who is the killer?

titles.contentInfo: S21, E3. The Sting of Death
titles.description: To what lengths will the Deddington family go to ensure they're never dethroned?
titles.longDescription: The Deddington family has a thriving bee empire that put Granville Norton on the map, but how far will they go to ensure they are never dethroned?

titles.description: In the village of Solomon Gorge, plans to catch a giant fish are threatened.
titles.guidance: Expect some violent scenes.
titles.longDescription: Women and fishermen flock to the village of Solomon Gorge, each person desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake. However, their plans are threatened.

titles.contentInfo: S22, E1. The Wolf Hunter of Little Worthy
titles.description: An urban myth gains a cult following - and results in a murder.
titles.episodeTitle: The Wolf Hunter of Little Worthy
titles.longDescription: After a struggling photographer wins a competition to create an urban myth, his creation of The Wolf Hunter unexpectedly gains a cult following - and results in a murder.

titles.description: Lives are cut short when someone is added to a club for recovering heart bypass patients.
titles.longDescription: Following the arrival of a new member to Midsomer's club for recovering heart bypass patients, lives are cut short at the clinic.

titles.description: A killer strikes for real during a murder mystery weekend.
titles.longDescription: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. The police's detective skills are put to the test as they are forced to solve this case on their own.

titles.description: The annual Midsomer Scarecrow Festival takes a grisly turn for the worse.
titles.guidance: Expect scenes of threat and violence.
titles.longDescription: Midsomer's annual scarecrow festival takes a grisly turn when dead bodies begin appearing on poles, but what is behind the murders?

titles.description: The body of an unknown man is found in an opera society theatre.
titles.longDescription: Amateur operatic society The Midsomer Mummers are busy rehearsing for a charity concert when the body of an unknown man is found in their theatre... but why?

titles.contentInfo: S22, E6. The Witches of Angel'S Rise
titles.description: Barnaby must step into the spiritual world to solve a killing linked to a psychic fayre.
titles.longDescription: Detective series based on the novels by Caroline Graham. Inspector Barnaby investigates murder mysteries in Middle England.

titles.description: Barnaby unravels a dark plot when a survivalist is found murdered in a bombproof shelter.
titles.guidance: with scenes of threat and violence from the start
titles.longDescription: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a dark conspiracy that reveals just how far people will go to escape the end of the world.

titles.contentInfo: E1. The Killings at Badger's Drift
titles.description: An elderly resident of Badger's Drift is found dead in her cottage - is it an accident?
titles.guidance: Contains violence and some sexual scenes.
titles.longDescription: The sleepy calm of Badger's Drift village is shattered when one of its elderly residents is found dead in her cottage. DCI Tom Barnaby is sure it was not an accident.
